alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Baton Rouge, east central Iberville and East Baton Rouge Parishes through 1015 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Brownfields, or near Baker, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, Westminster, Merrydale, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere, Brownfields, Old Jefferson, Shenandoah and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 145 and 166. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
